feed.title: Google Cloud: Dialogflow
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Dialogflow

entry.content: Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents): This is a correction of the release note posted on August 7, 2025. All deactivated models are now automatically upgraded to model gemini- 2.5-flash with the exception of generative fallback, which is automatically upgraded to gemini-2.5-flash-lite.
entry.summary: Dialogflow CX models have been updated. Deactivated models are now automatically upgraded to gemini-2.5-flash, with generative fallback upgraded to gemini-2.5-flash-lite.
entry.title: Announcement: Dialogflow CX Update

entry.content:
Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents): The following regions are now available:

  • asia-southeast2
  • europe-west4
  • europe-west6
entry.summary: We are announcing the expansion of Dialogflow CX availability to three new regions: asia-southeast2, europe-west4, and europe-west6.
entry.title: Feature: New Dialogflow CX regions available

entry.content: Dalogflow CX (Conversational Agents): New prompt security controls are available in agent settings. See the agent settings documentation for details.
entry.summary: New prompt security controls are now available in agent settings for Dialogflow CX. Refer to the agent settings documentation for more details.
entry.title: Feature: New Prompt Security Controls

entry.content:
Dialogflow CX (Conversational Agents) The model gemini-2.5-flash-lite is now available in all regions, and gemini-2.5-flash is now GA. These changes apply to the following features:

  • Generators
  • Playbooks
  • Data store tools
entry.summary: Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite is now accessible in all regions. Gemini 2.5 Flash is now generally available. These updates impact Generators, Playbooks, and Data store tools.
entry.title: Feature: Gemini 2.5 Flash Lite Now Available

entry.content:
Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI: The gemini-1.0-pro, gemini-1.5-pro and gemini-1.5-flash models will be deprecated on September 1, 2025 and automatically upgraded to the gemini-2.0-flash-001 model. This change applies to Vertex AI agents and the following Conversational Agents generative features:

  • Playbooks
  • Data stores
  • Generators
  • Generative Fallback

After the upgrade on September 1, 2024, gemini-2.0-flash-001 will be automatically selected in the console. We recommend that you upgrade to the new model early to allow enough time for testing and to ensure that your solution works as intended.
entry.summary: The gemini-1.0-pro, gemini-1.5-pro and gemini-1.5-flash models in Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI will be deprecated on September 1, 2025 and automatically upgraded to the gemini-2.0-flash-001 model.
entry.title: Deprecated: Model Deprecation in Dialogflow CX and Vertex AI

entry.content: Conversational Agents: Routine playbooks are now generally available.
entry.summary: Routine playbooks for Dialogflow CX are now available.
entry.title: Feature: New feature

entry.content: Conversational Agents: Parameter passing is now available and documented between routine playbooks, task playbooks, and flows.
entry.summary: Parameter passing is now available between routine playbooks, task playbooks, and flows.
entry.title: Feature: Parameter Passing in Conversational Agents

entry.content: Conversational Agents: 21 new Chirp 3 HD voices are now available across 34 locales.
entry.summary: Introducing new HD voices for conversational agents.
entry.title: Feature: New Voices Available

entry.content: Conversational Agents data stores: Conversational Agents now supports AlloyDB AI, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner and Cloud SQL data store source as public GA features; Microsoft Entra ID source has now private GA support. See the data store documentation for a complete list.
entry.summary: New data store options for conversational agents.
entry.title: Feature: Conversational Agents data stores update

entry.content: Conversational Agents: CMEK is now available in EU regions.
entry.summary: CMEK for conversational agents is now available in EU regions.
entry.title: Feature: CMEK now in EU

entry.content: Conversational Agents: The conversational history flow analysis feature is now available.
entry.summary: Analyze conversation history with the new flow analysis feature for conversational agents.
entry.title: Feature: New Flow Analysis Feature

entry.content:
Conversational Agents: The model gemini-2.5-flash is now available in all regions. This change applies to the following features:

  • Generators
  • Playbooks (Public Preview)
  • Data stores tools (Public Preview)
entry.summary: The Gemini 2.5 Flash model is now available in all regions for features including Generators, Playbooks (Public Preview), and Data Stores tools (Public Preview).
entry.title: Feature: Gemini 2.5 Flash Now Available in All Regions

entry.content: Conversational Agents data stores: Conversational Agents now supports AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner and Cloud SQL data store sources as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID source has now private GA support.
entry.summary: Dialogflow CX has added support for several new data store sources, including AlloyDB, Bigtable, Firestore, Spanner, and Cloud SQL, as public GA features. Microsoft Entra ID now has private GA support.
entry.title: Feature: New data store sources available in Dialogflow CX

entry.content: Conversational Agents data stores: You can now create some data store types directly within the Conversational Agents console rather than needing to use AI Applications. See the data store creation documentation for details.
entry.summary: You can now create data stores directly in the Conversational Agents console, simplifying the process. Previously, this required using AI Applications.
entry.title: Feature: Data Stores Now Available in Conversational Agents Console

entry.content: Conversational Agents: New Chirp 3 HD Cloud Text-to-Speech voice Autonoe is now available.
entry.summary: Autonoe, a new voice from Cloud Text-to-Speech, is now available. This voice is part of the Chirp 3 HD family.
entry.title: Feature: New Autonoe voice available

entry.content: Conversational Agents: Conversational Agents console now supports test cases.
entry.summary: You can now use test cases to test your conversational agents in the console.
entry.title: Feature: Test Cases for Conversational Agents

entry.content: Conversational Agents: Service agent access tokens used for authentication by both webhooks and tools are now discontinued as mentioned in notification emails to customers earlier this year. Most customers can use service accounts instead.
entry.summary: Service agent access tokens for conversational agents are no longer supported and have been discontinued. Service accounts are now recommended for authentication.
entry.title: Announcement: Access Tokens for Conversational Agents Discontinued

entry.content: Data store handlers: Data store handler use tracking for billing purposes has been corrected.
entry.summary: Tracking for billing purposes in data store handlers has been corrected.
entry.title: Changed: Data store billing tracking corrected
